publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2121 Mr Adam Ingram: Kilmarnock Football Club—That the Parliament deplores the derogatory remarks about Kilmarnock Football Club by a "Labour strategist" in the Times on 18 August 2001; notes the involvement of Labour MP Jim Murphy in the story; further notes that Kilmarnock FC finished fourth in the Scottish Premier League last season and won the Scottish Cup in 1996-97, and believes that such attacks on non-Old Firm clubs in the Scottish Premier League have no part to play in determining the future structure of league football in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Alex Neil*
S1M-2121 Kilmarnock Football Club (lodged on 22 August 2001) Kay Ullrich*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-2121 Mr Adam Ingram: Kilmarnock Football Club—That the Parliament deplores the derogatory remarks about Kilmarnock Football Club by a "Labour strategist" in the Times on 18 August 2001; notes the involvement of Labour MP Jim Murphy in the story; further notes that Kilmarnock FC finished fourth in the Scottish Premier League last season and won the Scottish Cup in 1996-97, and believes that such attacks on non-Old Firm clubs in the Scottish Premier League have no part to play in determining the future structure of league football in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Kay Ullrich, Ms Sandra White
S1M-2121 Kilmarnock Football Club (lodged on 22 August 2001) Tommy Sheridan*

Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Kay Ullrich, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie*
